name: Bitexco Financial Tower
address: 02 Hai Trieu, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: One of the highest skyscrapers in Vietnam with 68 floors
full_description:
Bitexco Financial Tower, an architectural marvel and a symbol of modernity, proudly stands as one of Vietnam's most iconic skyscrapers. Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, this impressive structure soars into the sky, dominating the city's skyline with its striking design and towering height.

Completed in 2010, the Bitexco Financial Tower is a testament to Vietnam's rapid development and progress on the global stage. Rising to a height of 262 meters (861 feet) with 68 floors, it claims the title of the tallest building in Vietnam and holds the distinction of being the 8th tallest building in the world.

Inspired by the delicate beauty of the lotus flower, a cherished symbol in Vietnamese culture, the tower's architecture reflects a sense of determination and positive energy. Its sleek and modern facade, clad in glass and aluminum, exudes elegance and sophistication.

reviews.content: Nice place. Cool!
Too hot but the architecture looks great

name: Landmark 81
address: 720A Dien Bien Phu, Vinhomes Central Park, Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A Skyward Marvel in Vietnam and the World
full_description:
The Landmark 81 is an impressive skyscraper that stands tall in Vietnam's bustling city. It proudly holds the title of the country's tallest building and ranks among the top eight tallest buildings in the world. With its remarkable architecture and design, it reflects the nation's ambition and progress.

Over the years, The Landmark 81 has gained recognition for its outstanding features. It offers a stunning sky view of the city, making it a favorite spot for visitors. Inside, it houses the largest indoor ice skating rink, providing fun and entertainment for all.

The building is also known for its luxury offerings and excellent amenities. It caters to those seeking a lavish living experience, ensuring they have everything they need for a comfortable and sophisticated lifestyle.

reviews.content: It's hugeeeeeee
The park around it looks clean and fresh tho.
Definitely will go again!

name: Ben Thanh Market
address: Le Loi Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: One of the earliest buildings in Vietnam and has been the icon of the city since then
full_description:
Ben Thanh Market, an iconic landmark and bustling marketplace in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, has been an integral part of the city's history and culture for centuries. This age-old treasure stands as a testament to the enduring spirit of the Vietnamese people and serves as a vibrant hub of commerce and cultural exchange.

Located at the intersection of Le Loi, Ham Nghi, Tran Hung Dao, and Le Lai streets, the market is easily recognizable by its striking clock tower, which has become a symbol of Saigon's dynamic energy. As the sun rises, the market comes alive with a flurry of activity, with vendors setting up their stalls and eager shoppers exploring the vast array of goods on display.

Ben Thanh Market offers a delightful sensory experience, with its vibrant colors, tantalizing aromas, and lively sounds. Inside, you'll find a treasure trove of local handicrafts, clothing, textiles, jewelry, souvenirs, and fresh produce. The market is divided into various sections, each specializing in different products, ensuring there's something for everyone.

reviews.content: Very local, very saigon. But you gotta know how to bargain
The prices seems to be higher to foreigners, don't know why
Now i know that they do support money exchange. The rate is good

name: War Remnants Museum
address: 28 Vo Van Tan, Ward 6, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A member of the International Network of Peace Museums
full_description:
The War Remnants Museum, located in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, stands as a poignant testament to the harrowing realities of the Vietnam War. Formerly known as the 'Exhibition House for US and Puppet Crimes' the museum is a must-visit for those seeking to understand the war's impact on Vietnam and its people.

As visitors step into the museum, they are immersed in a chronicle of the war's history, depicted through an extensive collection of photographs, artifacts, and exhibits. The photographs, captured by renowned war photographers, provide a haunting visual narrative of the war's atrocities, showcasing the human toll and the devastating effects on the lives of Vietnamese civilians and soldiers.

reviews.content: A deeply moving experience that sheds light on the horrors of war. The museum's exhibits are powerful and thought-provoking.
While informative, the displays can be distressing for some visitors. Not recommended for young children.

name: Central Post Office
address: 02 Paris Commune Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: An iconic French-inspired historical building in Saigon
full_description: As visitors step inside the Central Post Office, they are greeted by the soaring arched ceilings and the sight of the meticulously crafted interior. The large portrait of Ho Chi Minh, a beloved figure in Vietnam's history, adorns the walls, reminding everyone of the nation's resilience and unity. The post office's bustling atmosphere, filled with people mailing letters and packages, blends harmoniously with the whispers of history that echo through the halls. From the ornate telephone booths to the vintage maps and clocks, every corner tells a story of the past, creating a sense of wonder and nostalgia. The Central Post Office stands not only as a functional hub for communication but also as a timeless tribute to the enduring spirit of Saigon, preserving its heritage for generations to come.

reviews.content: Really cool old building! Loved the vintage vibes and took some great selfies here. It's a nice break from the busy streets outside.
WOW! This post office is like a work of art. Soaring ceilings and beautiful architecture. Sending postcards from here was fun!
Not gonna lie, it's pretty, but way too crowded for me. Hard to find a quiet spot to appreciate the history.
I'm in love with this post office! If I ever wanted to feel like I'm in a fairytale, this is the place. Instagrammable AF!
Impressive architecture and the atmosphere inside is bustling. Highly recommend checking it out! PS: Postcards make great souvenirs.

name: Saigon Opera House
address: 07 Cong Truong Lam Son, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: Immerse yourself in a classical atmosphere amidst the modernity of Saigon
full_description:
The Saigon Opera House is a magnificent gem that embraces elegance and sophistication. Built in the late 19th century, it stands as a historic cultural landmark and hosts a myriad of captivating performances, from traditional Vietnamese opera to contemporary shows.

With its grand facade and ornate architecture, the Opera House exudes an air of timeless beauty, drawing art enthusiasts and curious onlookers alike. The stage inside becomes a canvas for artistic expressions, where tales of love, heroism, and drama come to life, leaving audiences spellbound. Whether you are a local or a traveler passing through, the Saigon Opera House invites you to immerse yourself in the magic of the performing arts, creating cherished memories that resonate long after the curtains close.

reviews.content: Attended a live show here, and it was incredible! The architecture is stunning, and the performances are top-notch. A must-visit in Saigon!
Beautiful French colonial building with a touch of Vietnamese culture. Enjoyed the evening vibes around the opera house. Great for photos!
It's a historical icon, but I expected more from the inside. I guess it's better to catch a show here to fully appreciate it.

name: Walking Street
address: Nguyen Hue Walking Street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A famous walking route within the heart of the city
full_description:
Nguyen Hue Walking Street is a vibrant and bustling pedestrian promenade located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. Stretching from the iconic Saigon City Hall to the Saigon River, this picturesque street is a favorite gathering spot for both locals and tourists.

The walking street is named after Nguyen Hue, a famous Vietnamese military commander, and is a symbol of the city's rich history and culture. Lined with majestic trees and colorful flower beds, the street exudes a lively and welcoming ambiance. It serves as a central hub for various social activities and events, making it a popular destination for people of all ages.

Throughout the day, Nguyen Hue Walking Street teems with activity. As the sun sets, the street comes alive with dazzling lights that illuminate the entire area, creating a magical atmosphere. Local artists and performers showcase their talents, entertaining the crowds with traditional music, dance performances, and other cultural displays.

reviews.content: Love this vibrant walking street! There's always something exciting happening here - street performances, food stalls, and a lively atmosphere. Perfect for an evening hangout!
Nguyen Hue is a great place to take a stroll and enjoy the city vibes. I especially like the light displays at night. Very picturesque!
It's a popular spot for tourists, but it gets too crowded sometimes. The street vendors are a bit pushy. Visit on weekdays for a better experience.

name: Saigon Notre-Dame Cathedral
address: 01 Paris Commune Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A noble symbol of Catholicism in Vietnam
full_description:
The Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica of Saigon, located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City (formerly known as Saigon), Vietnam, is an exquisite masterpiece of architecture and a significant religious landmark in the country. Also known as Saigon Notre-Dame Cathedral, it stands as a symbol of faith, history, and French colonial influence in Vietnam.

Constructed between 1863 and 1880 during the French colonial period, the cathedral was inspired by the iconic Notre-Dame de Paris in France. Its imposing facade, built with red bricks brought from France, showcases twin bell towers that soar majestically into the sky, reaching a height of about 58 meters (190 feet). The exterior is adorned with beautiful sculptures and delicate stained glass windows, adding to its grandeur and allure.

Throughout its history, the cathedral has witnessed significant events, including religious ceremonies, state functions, and moments of historical importance. It has stood as a witness to the changing tides of Vietnam's history and continues to be a place of prayer and worship for the Catholic community.

reviews.content: Wow, what a magnificent cathedral! The architecture is stunning, and the interior is so peaceful. A must-visit in the heart of the city.
Impressive historical building with beautiful stained glass windows. It can get crowded, but it's worth seeing. I recommend going early to avoid the tourist rush!
The cathedral is a symbol of history, but it's under renovation now, so part of it was covered. Kinda disappointed, but I guess it's necessary.

name: Bui Vien Street
address: Bui Vien Street, Pham Ngu Lao Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: Experience the vibrant nightlife of Saigon, a city that never sleeps
full_description:
Bui Vien Walking Street, situated in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City's bustling District 1, is a vibrant and lively hub that offers an unforgettable experience for both locals and tourists alike. Stretching along Bui Vien Street and its adjacent alleys, this popular destination has earned its reputation as the 'backpacker's area' due to its appeal to international travelers seeking a taste of the city's vibrant nightlife and cultural diversity.

As the sun sets, Bui Vien Walking Street comes alive with a kaleidoscope of colors, sounds, and aromas. The street is lined with a plethora of restaurants, bars, cafes, and street food stalls, offering a delightful range of Vietnamese and international cuisines. From savoring the rich flavors of traditional pho and banh mi to indulging in Western dishes and exotic delicacies, there's something to tantalize every palate.

reviews.content: There are many bars and delicious restaurants on Bui Vien Street. So much fun!
Bui Vien Street is the heart of vibrant parties! Enjoyed hopping from one bar to another and trying various Vietnamese beers. The street food here is also amazing. Highly recommended!
It's a bustling street with many entertainment options, but it's too crowded for my liking. Prices can be higher for tourists too.
Had a fantastic night exploring Bui Vien Street. The live music and friendly atmosphere in every corner were incredible. Don't miss trying the grilled street food!

name: Dam Sen Water Park
address: 03 Hoa Binh, Ward 3, District 11, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A famous water park in Ho Chi Minh City.
full_description:
Dam Sen Water Park is a cherished oasis of fun and relaxation nestled in the bustling city of Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam. A beloved destination for families, friends, and thrill-seekers, it promises an unforgettable experience filled with joy and excitement.

As you step into Dam Sen Water Park, you are greeted by a vibrant world of aquatic wonders. The park boasts a myriad of water-based activities, perfect for beating the tropical heat. Adventurers can indulge in thrilling water slides that twist and turn, offering heart-pounding moments of exhilaration. The lazy rivers gently carry visitors on a soothing journey through lush greenery, providing a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

The refreshing pools at Dam Sen Water Park invite guests to dive into a refreshing aquatic paradise. Whether you're a skilled swimmer or just looking to relax, the pools cater to every preference. Families can splash around in the shallow areas, creating cherished memories with their little ones.

nearby_activities.event_name: Ho Chi Minh City Children's Cultural House for Youth

reviews.content: Dam Sen Water Park is a great place to cool off and have fun with family and friends. The water slides are thrilling!
I had a fantastic time at Dam Sen Water Park. The wave pool and lazy river were so enjoyable!
Dam Sen Water Park is fun, but it can get crowded on weekends. Consider visiting on a weekday.
The water park is well-maintained and clean. It's a perfect place to spend a hot summer day!

name: Independence Palace
address: 135 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A symbol of peace and national unity
full_description:
Independence Palace, also known as Reunification Palace, is an iconic historical landmark situated in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. It holds deep significance as the site where pivotal events in Vietnam's history unfolded, leading to the reunification of North and South Vietnam.

Originally constructed as the Norodom Palace during the French colonial era, the building's construction began in 1868 and was completed in 1873. However, the palace underwent significant renovations and expansions in the following years, culminating in its current form, which was completed in 1966.

The architecture of Independence Palace blends modernist elements with traditional Vietnamese design, creating a unique and captivating visual appeal. The sprawling compound features spacious gardens, elegant corridors, and ceremonial halls, exuding a sense of grandeur and authority.

reviews.content: The Independence Palace is a historical gem! The guided tour was informative, and the architecture is stunning.
A must-visit landmark in Ho Chi Minh City. The palace grounds are spacious, and the history is fascinating.
The Independence Palace is significant, but I wish there were more interactive exhibits.

name: Saigon Central Book Street
address: Nguyen Van Binh Street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A dream destination for book enthusiasts
full_description:
Central Book Street, a literary haven nestled in the heart of the city, is a beloved destination for book enthusiasts and casual readers alike. Located in the bustling downtown area, this enchanting street is dedicated to the world of books, fostering a vibrant literary culture and celebrating the written word.

Lined with charming bookshops, cozy cafes, and inviting reading corners, Central Book Street offers a unique and immersive experience for bibliophiles. As you stroll along the cobblestone pathways, the rich aroma of freshly printed books fills the air, enticing you to explore the treasures that lie within.

At the heart of Central Book Street, a picturesque square serves as a hub of cultural activities and book-related events. Authors' book signings, poetry readings, and book fairs are just a few of the enchanting happenings that breathe life into this literary oasis.

reviews.content: I loved strolling along Saigon Central Book Street. So many books to explore and cozy cafes to read in!
Saigon Central Book Street is charming, but the book prices are a bit higher than regular bookstores.

name: Saigon Zoo and Botanical Gardens
address: 02 Nguyen Binh Khiem, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: An oasis of nature in the heart of the city
full_description:
Saigon Zoo and Botanical Garden, nestled in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, is a captivating oasis of natural beauty and wildlife wonders. Established in 1865, it holds the distinction of being the oldest zoo in the country and has since become a beloved destination for locals and tourists seeking a respite from the bustling city.

Spread across a sprawling expanse, the zoo and botanical garden offer a delightful escape into the wonders of the animal kingdom and the lush embrace of nature. As you wander through its verdant pathways, you are greeted by a diverse array of flora and fauna, showcasing the rich biodiversity of Vietnam and beyond.

The botanical garden enchants visitors with its carefully curated collection of plants, trees, and flowers from various regions, creating a mesmerizing tapestry of colors and fragrances. Rare and exotic species coexist alongside native plants, creating a harmonious sanctuary for nature enthusiasts and botany aficionados.

nearby_activities.event_name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts

reviews.content: Saigon Zoo and Botanical Garden is a delightful place for a family outing. Kids will love seeing the animals!
I had a wonderful time at the zoo. The botanical garden is a peaceful oasis in the middle of the city.
Saigon Zoo and Botanical Garden is well-maintained, and the variety of plant species is impressive.
The zoo is fantastic! Just be prepared for the hot weather and bring plenty of water.
The zoo is enjoyable, but some enclosures could be larger for the animals' well-being.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts
address: 97A Pho Duc Chinh, Nguyen Thai Binh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: An exquisite collection of artistic masterpieces
full_description:
The Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts, situated in the heart of bustling Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, is a cultural gem that showcases the country's rich artistic heritage. Housed in an elegant colonial-era building, the museum itself is a work of art and a testament to the city's historical charm.

Upon entering the museum, visitors are greeted with a diverse collection of artworks spanning various periods, styles, and mediums. From traditional Vietnamese paintings, sculptures, and lacquerware to contemporary art and modern installations, the museum offers a comprehensive and immersive journey through the evolution of Vietnamese art.

The museum's exhibits provide a glimpse into the country's artistic traditions, reflecting its cultural diversity and the fusion of Eastern and Western influences. Visitors can marvel at intricate silk paintings depicting scenes of daily life, ancient ceramics adorned with exquisite patterns, and delicate woodcarvings that showcase the skill of Vietnamese artisans.

reviews.content: The Museum of Fine Arts has a decent collection, but it lacks some famous artworks I expected to see.
I enjoyed my visit to the Museum of Fine Arts. It's a peaceful place to appreciate art.
The museum has some beautiful pieces, but I wish there were more English descriptions.

name: History Museum
address: 02 Nguyen Binh Khiem, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A journey through Vietnam's fascinating history
full_description:
The History Museum of Ho Chi Minh City, located in the heart of Vietnam's bustling metropolis, is a treasure trove of the nation's rich heritage and storied past. Housed within a grand neoclassical building that reflects its historical significance, the museum stands as a gateway to understanding the cultural evolution of this vibrant city and the entire country.

The museum's extensive collection spans thousands of years, showcasing artifacts and exhibits that highlight Vietnam's diverse history, from its ancient civilizations to the modern era. Visitors are taken on a captivating journey through time, exploring the rise and fall of dynasties, the influence of various cultures, and the resilience of the Vietnamese people.

nearby_activities.event_name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts

reviews.content: The History Museum provides a fascinating insight into Vietnam's past. Don't miss the ancient artifacts!
I loved exploring the History Museum. Each exhibit is well-curated and educational.
The museum offers a rich history of Vietnam. I recommend hiring a guide for a better understanding.

name: Giac Lam Pagoda
address: 565 Lac Long Quan, Ward 10, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: The oldest pagoda in Ho Chi Minh City
full_description:
Giac Lam Pagoda, an ancient and revered Buddhist temple, is a cultural and spiritual gem nestled within the bustling city of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. With its origins dating back over three centuries, it stands as one of the oldest and most significant pagodas in the region, holding a cherished place in the hearts of locals and pilgrims alike.

Located in the Tan Binh District, the pagoda's serene and inviting atmosphere offers a respite from the urban clamor, providing a tranquil sanctuary for contemplation and prayer. As you approach the entrance, the intricate gate and imposing stone pillars welcome you into this sacred realm, where the essence of Buddhism permeates the air.

The pagoda's architectural design follows a blend of Chinese and Vietnamese influences, showcasing a distinctive blend of cultural traditions. Its ornate and colorful facade features splendidly crafted carvings and statues of Buddhist deities, dragons, and mythical creatures, each contributing to the pagoda's allure.

reviews.content: Giac Lam Pagoda is a peaceful place, but it can get crowded with tourists.
I found the architecture and history of Giac Lam Pagoda intriguing. Worth a visit!
While the pagoda is beautiful, the surroundings are noisy due to nearby traffic.

name: Crescent Mall
address: 101 Ton Dat Tien, Tan Phu Ward, District 7, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A modern shopping, dining and entertainment complex
full_description:
A bustling destination that caters to the diverse needs and desires of locals and tourists alike. Situated in the Phu My Hung urban area, Crescent Mall has become an iconic landmark, drawing shoppers from all corners of the city.

As you step inside, you are greeted with a contemporary and spacious interior, designed to provide a pleasant and comfortable shopping experience. The mall boasts a wide array of retail stores, offering everything from high-end fashion brands to popular international and local labels. Fashion enthusiasts can explore the latest trends and styles, while those seeking unique souvenirs can find a variety of specialty shops.

Beyond fashion, Crescent Mall is a haven for food lovers. Its extensive food court and a variety of restaurants offer a diverse range of cuisines, ranging from traditional Vietnamese delicacies to international flavors. Visitors can indulge in mouthwatering dishes while relishing the vibrant atmosphere of the mall.

reviews.content: Crescent Mall is a fantastic shopping destination with a great variety of stores and restaurants.
I had a wonderful time shopping and dining at Crescent Mall. It's modern and well-designed.
Crescent Mall is a shopper's paradise. Just be prepared for occasional crowds on weekends.
Crescent Mall has everything you need, from fashion to food. A great place to spend the day.
Crescent Mall offers a wide range of entertainment options, making it suitable for all ages.

name: Tao Dan Park
address: Truong Dinh Street, Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
short_description: A great place to enjoy the fresh air and rewind
full_description:
Tao Dan Park, a lush urban oasis nestled in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, is a beloved green sanctuary that offers respite from the bustling city life. Spanning over 10 hectares, the park serves as a haven for locals and visitors alike, drawing people of all ages to its serene and picturesque surroundings.

As you enter the park, you are greeted by a canopy of towering trees and a symphony of chirping birds, creating a soothing atmosphere that instantly transports you away from the urban chaos. The well-maintained pathways wind their way through the park, inviting visitors to take leisurely strolls, jog, or simply enjoy a moment of tranquility amid nature's embrace.

Tao Dan Park is a place of gathering and social interaction. In the early morning, you will find groups of people practicing tai chi, yoga, or other forms of exercise, fostering a sense of community and wellness. As the day progresses, families and friends converge to enjoy picnics, play games, or engage in various recreational activities.

nearby_activities.event_name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts

reviews.content: Tao Dan Park is a tranquil oasis in the heart of the city. Perfect for morning walks!
I enjoy reading books under the shade of trees in Tao Dan Park. Such a lovely atmosphere.
Tao Dan Park is nice, but the litter can be an issue on busy days.
